Hi Guys...,

Using the latest version of BackDrop and all modules are up to date.

I've created a View which has a PDF file.

Formatter is "Generic file"
Rewrite output "Output this field as a link"
Target "_blank"

and it's not opening in a blank window.

I've also tried the Formatter as a "Download link"

I've also tried using the [title] as a replacement text but then a space is added to the filename in the URL.

Any help or pointers to a solution would be appreciated :)

Thanks in advance.

Tried it with Firefox and Chrome.

<a href="/files/pdfs/%20Exemption.pdf" target="_blank"><span class="file"><img class="file-icon" alt="PDF icon" title="application/pdf" src="/core/modules/file/icons/application-pdf.png"> </span></a><a href="https://bmpc.albanytest.co.uk/files/pdfs/Exemption.pdf" type="application/pdf; length=866125">Exemption.pdf</a> </td>

I think you need to override theme_file_link in your theme instead of doing this via the Views UI. Reason is that the file is being output as an icon followed by a textual link. When you add your own link using Views, it wraps all of that in another link. Since you can't have a link within a link, then your Views link is being applied to just the icon and it's using this theme function's link for the text. So the only way to override that is via the theme function (or use a different formatter in Views).

Thanks Pete...,
